item.title: 6 Bangladeshi peacekeepers killed in Sudan
item.description: Six Bangladeshi peacekeepers have been killed and eight others injured in an attack on a United Nations base in Abyei, Sudan, the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) has confirmed. The assault occurred amid ongoing clashes in the region, the military’s media wing said in a statement issue

item.title: Salah returns for Liverpool amid uncertainty over Merseyside future
item.description: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah made his return for the Merseyside club to loud applause and a standing ovation at Anfield during Saturday's Premier League clash with Brighton & Hove Albion. The Egyptian, whose future at the club has been in doubt since his scathing criticism a week earlier, was n

item.title: Hadi remains in critical condition with injury to brain stem, hospital says
item.description: Inquilab Mancha spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi, who was shot in the capital’s Bijoynagar area on Friday, remains in critical condition while undergoing treatment at Evercare Hospital in Dhaka, hospital authorities said on Saturday. Doctors said the bullet caused severe damage to Hadi’s

item.title: RMG export to US beats BD’s competitors
item.description: Bangladesh's apparel export to the United States, its single-largest market, circumvents tariff tempests and records a double-digit growth of18.64 per cent, the highest among major competitors, in the first nine months of 2025. According to US official count, the exports grew both in terms of va

item.title: CA meets Hadi family, vows justice, full med support
item.description: Bangladesh's major political parties pledge to stay united against a "coordinated bid" to jeopardize the July uprising and jointly protest the shooting of an activist and prospective independent election candidate, Sharif Osman Hadi. Leaders from the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), Jamaat-e-Is

item.title: Hadi still in critical condition: Doctor
item.description: Doctors said on Saturday the condition of Inqilab Mancha spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi remained critical due to the severe brain injury he suffered in the shooting by assailants in the city on Friday. Director (media services) at Evercare Hospital Bangladesh Dr Arif Mahmud said that the condition

item.title: Govt mulls converting Bhola island gas to LNG
item.description: The government mulls converting around 30 million cubic feet per day (mmcfd) of unutilised natural gas of gas-rich Bhola island to LNG and carrying it to gas-starved industries in the mainland for consumption, said sources. The volume of converted LNG to be processed from Bhola gas will be only 2.

item.title: NPL surge triggers systemic banking shock
item.description: Bangladesh is facing a growing "systemic shock" from non-performing loans (NPLs), with bad debts reaching record highs in 2024-25 and laying bare deep vulnerabilities in the country's banking sector. The sharp deterioration in asset quality has constrained banks' ability to lend and raised fresh c

item.title: 26th AGM of IPL held
item.description: The 26th Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the International Publications Ltd (IPL), the owning company of The Financial Express, was held on Saturday at the board room of the Apex Footwear Ltd in Gulshan with IPL Chairman Mr Mahbubur Rahman presiding. — FE photo The 26th Annual General Meetin

item.title: Tk 5.0m bounty announced for shooting suspect
item.description: The interim government has announced a reward of Tk 5.0 million for information leading to the arrest of Faisal Karim Masud, the prime suspect in the shooting of Inquilab Mancha spokesperson and Dhaka-8 independent election hopeful Sharif Osman Hadi. The attack, carried out in broad daylight in th

item.title: Project aid to be trimmed by Tk 140b in FY26 RADP
item.description: The government is likely to significantly reduce the project aid portion in the upcoming Revised Annual Development Programme (RADP) for the current fiscal year (FY) 2025-26, as many agencies have failed to implement projects on time, officials said on Saturday. The allocation from foreign project

item.title: IFAD approves $51.4m co-financing
item.description: The Executive Board of the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD), at its 146th session held on December 9-10, approved US$51.4 million in financing as IFAD's contribution to a $211.7 million project in Bangladesh, a spokesman said on Saturday.
